stream_context.summary: Livestream focused on building Course 13 (a surreal icy castle) for Return to Yoshi’s Island. Kaze tweaks platform layout, tests performance/visual features on real N64 hardware, and co-hosts a live reaction to the F3 fangame showcase.

development_findings.summary: Kaze’s bug-and-performance to-do list is almost finished after a week of fixes and small optimisation wins, including a pipe that never worked on real N64 now functioning.
development_findings.quote: Over the last week I did a lot of bug fixing… I almost finished my to-do list regarding bugs and performance issues.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a toggleable anti-aliasing option and confirmed stable 45–46 FPS in demanding areas on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: When you want anti-aliasing, there you go… 45 to 46 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Achieved ‘infinite drawing distance’ in the Bunny Brush level while keeping 60 FPS on N64, showcasing engine progress.
development_findings.quote: This level has infinite drawing distance even on 64… it’s still at 60 FPS sometimes.

development_findings.summary: Added protective-gear ‘fuzzies’ enemy redesign (concept & model by Biobak) to Lost Impact-style area.
Bowser Office and Bowser Elevator now have dedicated music tracks integrated, improving atmosphere.
development_findings.quote: We have a song for the Bowser office and the Bowser elevator now, and they’re both great.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 design: slide → snowman path → treasure room. Platforms re-aligned and level narrowed to reduce camera glitches; scheduled to finish within a month, leaving only two levels unfinished.
development_findings.quote: I hope I can finish this level in the next month or so and then it’s just two levels missing.

development_findings.summary: Identified camera problems in very large areas; may create a new technical solution rather than redesign everything.
development_findings.quote: I might have to invent a solution to that problem.

development_findings.summary: One-button pipeline builds and streams the ROM directly to a capture-carded N64 for immediate hardware testing.
development_findings.quote: All I have to do… is hit this button… then we are on the real N64. It’s as shrimpless as that.

development_findings.summary: Game size target is <64 MB and still runs from original N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Mario 64 Mega is 99 terabytes. Nope, it’s going to be under 64 megabytes.

development_findings.summary: Audio pipeline accepts MIDI or even WAV/MP3; ADPCM currently used, exploring future OPUS compression to fit full OST.
development_findings.quote: Ideally you would export it as a MIDI… I still hope that one day OPUS compression… is good enough that we can just put a whole hack’s OST on it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina became parents five days prior; Zeina’s mother is helping, so development continues with manageable fatigue.
context_findings.quote: Yes, the baby came out five days ago… it doesn’t feel like that much, although it’s probably a lot more work for Zeina than for me.

context_findings.summary: Kaze believes ROM hacks can be more creative than commercial games because they don’t need to sell, influencing his design ethos.
context_findings.quote: When you have to sell well, you have to make something somewhat bland. ROM hacks can get a little more creative.

context_findings.summary: Art philosophy: rejects rule-based ‘principles’; instead designs for emotional impact and holistic feeling.
context_findings.quote: If you operate on principles, you make art for critics, you don’t make art for the sake of it being experienced.

context_findings.summary: Strong stance against self-censorship over Nintendo C&D fears; advocates releasing hacks openly or via anonymous leaks.
context_findings.quote: If you make a fan game and you shut up about it… you C&D’d yourself.

context_findings.summary: Plans physical boxed set (manual + art) with no Nintendo IP so fans can pair it with unofficial cartridges; cannot legally sell carts himself.
context_findings.quote: I am not allowed to sell real cartridges… but I am planning to do is make a box and a book inlet without any Nintendo references.

biobak.summary: Designed and modelled new ‘protective gear’ fuzzies enemy, which Kaze showcased with pride.
biobak.quote: This was Biobak’s idea and Biobak made the model.

biobak.summary: May rework the Koopa Carnival course for additional polish, per Kaze’s hopes.

badub.summary: Composed newly added music for Bowser Office and Bowser Elevator (implied responsibility as main composer).

zeina.summary: Regularly appears in chat; currently prioritising newborn care but expected to appear on future streams for cameos.
zeina.quote: I’m sure Zeina is going to show up at least a few times again.

key_stories.title: Instant N64 Hardware Testing
key_stories.summary: Kaze demonstrates a streamlined build-and-test workflow: one button exports the ROM and boots it on a live-captured N64, letting viewers see genuine hardware performance within seconds.
key_stories.challenge: Need to validate graphics and FPS on real hardware without lengthy flashcart steps.
key_stories.process: Automated build script + capture card; physical console booted mid-stream.
key_stories.outcome: Reliable, rapid performance checks (e.g., anti-aliasing at 45 FPS, infinite draw distance).
key_stories.key_quote: All I have to do… is hit this button… then we are on the real N64. It’s as shrimpless as that.

key_stories.title: Designing Course 13’s Slide & Castle
key_stories.summary: While building the icy castle (Course 13), Kaze refines jump angles, narrows geometry to fix camera bugs, and plans a treasure-filled finale. He aims to finish the level within a month, bringing the project close to content-complete.
key_stories.challenge: Initial layout caused awkward wall-kicks, pacing issues, and camera glitches in large rooms.
key_stories.process: Live geometry edits, platform realignment, adding longer run-ups, shrinking room size.
key_stories.outcome: Playable first section completed; clear roadmap for remaining rooms.
key_stories.key_quote: Let’s make it easier… and bring everything in a little bit so that the camera issue doesn’t pop up.

key_stories.title: Becoming a Father Mid-Development
key_stories.summary: Kaze became a father to Reyna five days before the stream. Despite life change, he continues daily development, crediting Zeina and her mother for support and reflecting on workload balance.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate newborn care with demanding hack schedule.
key_stories.process: Family support system; Zeina’s mom handles much of the infant care while Kaze streams and codes.
key_stories.outcome: Project momentum maintained; personal perspective on work-life balance shared with community.
key_stories.key_quote: Everyone was always talking about how having a child is so much work… it doesn’t feel like that much, although it’s probably a lot more work for Zeina than for me.
